intro: Assonia natalensis, commonly known as Natal assonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which are followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
